title: Prepare for release 0.12.1-rc1.
Update dependencies.
Gracefully deal with failing timestamp conversions.
body: This PR switches to using the non-panicking versions of chrono’s timestamp conversion methods introduced in 0.4.23.

title: fix(http_listener): set correct error message on missing tls options
body: refer to http cert/key instead of rtr ones

title: Chdir to chroot if no working dir is given.
body:
This PR changes the behavior on Unix by setting the working directory to the chroot directory if the latter is given but not the former.

Fixes #822.

title: Only set extra-tals-dir command line option if present.
body:
This PR fixes a mistake where a missing `--extra-tals-dir` command line option would clear any value set via a config file.

Fixes #820.

title: Prepare for release 0.12.0.
Add missing rsync install-time dependency for cross-compiled DEBs.
body:
Fixes #817.

Note that the latest 0.12.0-dev DEB does **NOT** have this problem because there are [bugs in the reusable packaging workflow](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/issues/19) concerning minimal and cross cargo-deb variant selection when building DEBs, so this "fix" doesn't actually fix anything because by accident it isn't currently broken. When the reusable packaging workflow bugs are fixed, then this fix will be needed.

title: Upgrade reusable packaging workflow
body:
This PR upgrades the `pkg` workflow to use the latest version of the NLnet Labs [Ploutos](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/) reusable packaging workflow. There have been a number of breaking releases of Ploutos fixing bugs, improving performance and simplifying its use:

- [v2](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v2.0.0) checks for RPM scriptlet errors, eliminates 23 annoying Github workflow run warnings (caused by deprecated actions and the coming upgrade by GH to NodeJS 16) and introduces (optional) support for systemd unit management in RPM scriptlets. This PR adopts the new RPM systemd unit management behaviour. A check of the new managed behaviour vs the old manual behaviour shows that the only difference is use of newer systemctl command syntax on systems that support it, e.g. use of `--now` to achieve in one command what requires two commands on older systemd versions. The new systemd managed script fragments also include an explicit `systemd-reload`.

- [v3](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v3.0.0) simplified usage by folding the `xxx_rules_path` functionality into the `xxx_rules` workflow inputs., fixes an issue with `minimal` profile selection on older O/S's, and removes the need for manual specification of cross-compilation targets (these are now determined automatically from the other workflow inputs). This PR updates the `pkg` workflow to follow the `xxx_rules` changes.

- [v4](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/releases/v4.0.0) of the packaging workflow enables cross-compilation to take place in parallel with non-cross compilation thereby speeding up the workflow. In the case of Routinator this seems to reduce the time from ~16m to ~8m, about a 50% reduction!

- [v5](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/ploutos/releases/tag/v5.0.0) simplified usage by removing the need to specify redundant DEB maintainer name/email and package testing rule inputs, and fixes issues with slow `yum` operations and broken DEB changelog generation.

This PR:
- Adjusts the inputs passed in `pkg.yml` to Ploutou to match the breaking changes made to Ploutos.
  - Remove no longer supported or needed `deb_maintainer` Ploutos input.
  - Remove no longer needed `cross_build_rules` Ploutos input and associated `pkg/rules/cross-targets.yml` file, Ploutos will determine cross-compilation targets itself based on the `package_build_rules` input.
  - Remove no longer needed `package_test_rules` Ploutos input and associated `pkg/rules/packages-to-test.yml` file.
  - Updates `pkg/rules/packages-to-build.yml` to include the `mode` key used by the Ploutos `pkg-test` job now that `packages-to-test.yml` no longer defines it.
  - Replaces manual invocation of systemd commands in `pkg/rpm/scriptlets.toml` with the `#RPM_SYSTEMD_MACROS#` placeholder instead which Ploutos replaces at package building time with appropriate systemd commands (just as cargo-deb does for DEBs).
- Re-orders and groups related Ploutos workflow inputs in `pkg.yml`.
- Removes the unused minimal-cross cargo-deb variant from `Cargo.toml` and the related `pkg/common/routinator-minimal-cross.routinator.service` file.

A test run of the `pkg` workflow in this PR branch can be seen here: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/3591659903.

title: Prepare for release 0.12.0-rc1.
Update dependencies.
body: This PR updates all dependencies to their latest version.

title: Document default Docker `server` subcmd and show how to listen on IPv6
body:
Triggered by #805.

Split out from PR #809.

title: Fix RTR client metrics.
body: This PR fixes two issues with RTR client metrics: For one, we accidentally used the local address to identify the client instead of the peer address. And second, the collapsing of multiple client metrics objects was broken.

title: Allow limiting the prefix length of included VRPs.
body:
This PR adds two new command line and config file options, `limit-v4-len` and `limit-v6-len`, that allow limiting the prefix length of IPv4 or IPv6 prefixes, respectively, for which VRPs are to be included in the output data set. By default, all valid VRPs are included.

Fixes #234.

title: Wrong HTTP port publish argument shown in Docker docs
body:
This PR builds on the Docker documentation changes made in PR #796 and aims to resolve issue #808.

The rendered changes can be seen here: https://routinator--809.org.readthedocs.build/en/809/installation.html

As port 8323 is used throughout the documentation and by both the DEB and RPM packages changing that would be very impacting. Changing from port 9956 to port 8323 in the Docker image would also be impacting. Thus the change made is to add HTTP listen port 8323 as well as HTTP listen port 9556 to the Docker image, and clarify the documentation.

title: Don’t print error on EPIPE in vrps to stdout.
body: This PR suppresses the error message when the `vrps` command is outputting the data set to stdout and receives a broken pipe error.

title: Log 'falling back to rsync' only once per repository.
body: Previously, the log message appeared for any publication point in the repository.

title: Deal more graciously with broken files in the store.
body:
This PR changes the behavior of Routinator when files are encountered in the store that cannot be parsed (as opposed to reading failing for other reasons). Now Routinator will just assume that the publication point stored in that file doesn’t exist in the store and continue.

Fixes #770.

title: Only use RRDP responses if the status code is 200.
body:
This PR fixes an issue in the RRDP collector which was processing all kinds of HTTP responses as valid. It now rejects everything that isn’t a 200 OK.

Fixes #779.

title: Set TCP keepalive for the RRDP HTTP client.
body:
This PR enables TCP keepalives for RRDP connections. The duration can be set via the new `rrdp-tcp-keepalive` command line and config file option. Setting this value to 0 disables TCP keepalives.

Fixes #751.

title: Add additional RTR client metrics.
body:
This PR adds three new values to the RTR client metrics:

- `last_reset` contains the time of the last cache reset by the client,
- `reset_queries` contains the number of reset queries by the client, and
- `serial_queries` contains the number of serial queries by the client.

These values are available both in the status and metrics endpoints.

Fixes #754.

title: Add an rrdp-fallback option to configure fallback to rsync.
body:
This PR introduces a new command line and config option `rrdp-fallback` that decides when to fall back to rsync for a failed RRDP update. The available policies are `never` for never, `stale` for fallback after a certain time of falling the RRDP update, and `new` for fallback when RRDP has never succeeded. The default is `stale` which reflects the current behavior.

Fixes #730.

title: Setting rsync-timeout to 0 disables the timeout.
body:
This PR adjust the `rsync-timeout` command line and config option to disable the rsync timeout completely if set to 0. This way it behaves the same way as `rrdp-timeout`.

Fixes #729.

title: Include the log level in logged messages.
body:
This PR adds the log level of a message to the output printed to files, stderr, and the `/log` endpoint.

Fixes #594.

title: Restructure TAL configuration and remove init command.
body:
This PR restructures the TAL configuration in response to the dropped requirement to opt into the ARIN TAL.

Routinator will now use the bundled RIR TALs directly unless told otherwise by the new `--no-rir-tals` command  line and config option. The additional bundled TALs can be added via the new `--tal` command line and config option. Additionally, the TAL directory can still be used via the `--extra-tals-dir` option. The `tal-dir` option has been removed but will still be accepted – and ignored – in the config file only. 

The `init` command has been removed. 

Fixes #788. Fixes #583.

title: Convert command line parsing to clap’s derive API.
body:
This PR converts command line parsing to a more safe implementation using clap’s derive API in most places.

Note that the init command has not been converted as it is going to be removed very soon.

title: Mention inodes on fatal ENOSPC errors.
body:
This PR modifies the `utils::fatal` module to replace the standard ‘No space left on device’ error message for ENOSPC errors on Unix to ‘No space or inodes left on device‘.

Fixes #785 and #778.

title: Increase minimal Rust version to 1.60.0.
Update clap to version 4.
inode usage requirements
Do not exit on malformed RRDP Base 64 data.
body:
This PR fixes an oversight in error handling in the RRDP collector that cause Routinator to exit if it encountered malformed Base 64 in RRDP snapshot and delta files.

It does this by re-appropriating the existing exception in MaxSizeRead to not exit when data was too large and extending it to all other read errors happening. This is fine because the encoded data is currently collected into a vec before any of this happens, so reading cannot fail other than from malformed Base 64 data.

This PR can be tested by using the TAL currently available at https://routinator.do.nlnetlabs.nl/test/rrdp/ta.tal.

This is the same PR as #781 accept applied to the main branch. It fixes CVE-2022-3029.

title: Prepare for release 0.11.3.
Do not exit on malformed RRDP Base 64 data.
Migrate to NLnetLabs reusable packaging workflow
body:
This PR obsoletes the following currently open PRs:
- #762
- #772
- #776

This PR replaces the current Packaging `pkg.yml` and Packaging Docker `pkg-docker.yml` workflows with a much simpler Packaging `pkg.yml` workflow that outsources the behaviour to a new equivalent reusable workflow defined in the NLnet Labs organisation wide https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github repository, which includes the functionality of the above obsoleted PRs.

As with the obsoleted PRs, this PR updates the `Dockerfile` to support both `build` and `copy` modes for the non-cross and cross-compiled cases respectively.

A successful test run against this PR branch can be seen here: https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/3052909026

The test run doesn't exercise the behaviour of pushing Docker images and manifests to Docker Hub as that only happens when a release Git tag (i.e. a tag named `v*` without a `-XXX` suffix) is pushed to this Git repository, but was tested elsewhere as part of the development of the centralized reusable workflow (e.g. [here](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/pull/6#issuecomment-1244335732)).

The centralized reusable packaging workflow (see https://github.com/NLnetLabs/.github/blob/master/.github/workflows/pkg-rust.yml) needs more documentation, but in short it is the result of combining and normalizing various fixes and improvements that were added to the Krill and Routinator workflows over time. While similar to the `pkg.yml` workflow defined in this repository prior to this PR, it is sufficiently changed so as to make a direct comparison via diff quite difficult. Changes have been made to make the workflow more generic and reusable and thus for example the set of architectures and operating systems to build for is no longer hard-coded but now passed in as a set of rules, and the scripts to run to test installed packages post install and upgrade are now stored as separate files in the repo and passed by filepath reference to the reusable workflow.

Note: This PR also modifies the way RPM scriptlets are defined because changes were needed to fix issues seen in the Krill and Routinator projects due to the limited way that the [`cargo-generate-rpm`](https://github.com/cat-in-136/cargo-generate-rpm) cargo helper command permits RPM scriptlets to be defined (i.e. they must be defined inline in TOML, they cannot be defined as references to Bash files stored separately).

title: Introduce WriteOrPanic trait for write!-ing without unwrap.
body:
This PR introduces a new utility trait `WriteOrPanic` which provides the method `write_fmt` that is used by `write!` macro and friends. But because it doesn’t return a result, it allows using the macro without unwrap or question mark.

The trait is implemented for `String` and `Vec<u8>` and used where needed.

Much like the trait’s name suggests, these implementations panic if formatting fails. That’s fine, as we only use with data that can be formatted and with types where writing itself can never fail (which I _think_ is the actual reason for returning a result). Also, we’ve been unwrapping for quite some time so, clearly, this is working.

This fixes #450.

title: Remove rrdp-disable-gzip option.
Update manual to inlucde tal member in jsonext.
body: This PR updates the manual – both the actual manual and the manual page – to describe the changes made in #765.

title: Remove cargo deb version hold
body:
The version of [cargo-deb](https://github.com/kornelski/cargo-deb/) used to create DEB packages was held at 1.34.2 because newer versions produced packages that were deemed invalid by Lintian on Ubuntu Xenial.

The underlying cause was [fixed yesterday](https://github.com/kornelski/cargo-deb/commit/ec4e00358bc3cc1abc6d3dd10f9bbf58f31a2cf5) and the [upstream issue](https://github.com/kornelski/cargo-deb/issues/12) was resolved. The new commit of cargo-deb `main` was then tested in [this Routinator `pkg` workflow run](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/2863785101).

The root cause was use of LZMA compression via O/S provided `xz` binary while older `dpkg` lacks support for LZMA compression. The fix was to not use O/S provided LZMA compression when the `lzma` feature of cargo-deb is disabled (which until now only disabled LZMA compression via cargo-deb Rust code but did not disable LZMA compression via O/S provided `xz` binary, if available).

This DRAFT PR is a placeholder to upgrade cargo-deb in our `pkg` workflow so that we are not held back to an old version which may cause much more work when we in future try and upgrade, and prevents us taking bug fixes and improvements from the cargo-deb project, or even raising issues against the project.

Once a new release of cargo-deb is made this PR can be updated to use it and this PR can be promoted from DRAFT to READY.

title: Correct a typo in Cargo.toml
List TAL in jsonext format.
body:
This PR adds a new member `"tal"` to the source information for data derived from RPKI objects in the extended JSON output format.

While at it, it also improves the formatting of user-provided strings in this format by properly escaping them.

Fixes #660.

title: Change the default and logging behaviour for unsafe-vrps
body:
This PR changes the default configuration option for unsafe-vrps to accept and removes all logging or mentioning of unsafe VRPs in this case. It also adds a pointer to the manual page for unsafe VRPs if any are logged.

Fixes #536.

title: Switch to Rust edition 2021.
body: This is a breaking change.

title: Use new cargo generate metadata overwrite feature
body: This DRAFT PR demonstrates that the [new metadata-overwrite feature](https://github.com/cat-in-136/cargo-generate-rpm/pull/36) being developed for `cargo-generate-rpm` can be used to avoid rewriting Cargo.toml during the packaging process in order to set the version correctly. It shouldn't be merged, rather if and when the upstream PR is merged we should return to this PR to update it to use the next release of `cargo-generate-rpm` that includes the new functionality.

title: Packaging fixes
body:
This PR:
- Fixes the failure on `main` by disabling testing of the generated DEB package for the Debian Stretch platform, as the Debian Stretch LXC image is no longer available on images.linuxcontainers.org.
- Removes the need to use an old Rust version to build Routinator when generating RPMs by upgrading to latest `cargo-generate-rpm`.
- Fixes a minor issue where one of the step names still referred to DEB packaging even though it is also run for RPMs.
- Upgrades cargo-deb to 1.36.0, the newest version that both supports Rust edition 2021 (to support PR #760) **AND** compiles without `lzma` support (required with newer Cargo deb versions in order to build a valid package on Ubuntu Xenial). See cargo deb issues https://github.com/kornelski/cargo-deb/issues/12 and https://github.com/kornelski/cargo-deb/issues/43.

A successful run of the `pkg` workflow using this PR branch can be seen [here](https://github.com/NLnetLabs/routinator/actions/runs/2782340811).

title: Describe unsafe VRPs in detail
body: Publishing this as a draft PR until we are happy with the description and examples. Then I will try to capture it in a supporting diagram.

title: Adjust error handling to rpki-rs 0.15.
